posts.title: leetcode 1048
posts.text: é¢˜ç›®ï¼š ç»™å‡ºä¸€ä¸ªå•è¯æ•°ç»„ words ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­æ¯ä¸ªå•è¯éƒ½ç”±å°å†™è‹±æ–‡å­—æ¯ç»„æˆï¼Œå¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ä¸æ”¹å˜å…¶ä»–å­—ç¬¦çš„é¡ºåº ï¼Œåœ¨wordA çš„ä»»ä½•åœ°æ–¹æ·»åŠ  æ°å¥½ä¸€ä¸ª å­—æ¯ä½¿å…¶å˜æˆwordBï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæˆ‘ä»¬è®¤ä¸ºwordAæ˜¯wordBçš„å‰èº«ã€‚ä¾‹å¦‚â€abcâ€æ˜¯â€abacâ€çš„å‰èº«ï¼Œè€Œâ€cbaâ€ä¸æ˜¯â€bcadâ€çš„å‰èº«ã€‚è¯é“¾å¼å•è¯[word_1,word_2, â€¦, word_k]ç»„æˆçš„åºåˆ—ï¼Œk>=1ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­word1æ˜¯word2çš„å‰èº«ï¼Œword2æ˜¯word3çš„å‰èº«ï¼Œä¾æ­¤ç±»æ¨ã€‚ä¸€ä¸ªå•è¯é€šå¸¸æ˜¯k==1çš„å•è¯é“¾ï¼Œä»ç»™å®šå•è¯åˆ—è¡¨wordsä¸­é€‰æ‹©å•è¯ç»„æˆè¯é“¾ï¼Œè¿”å›è¯é“¾çš„æœ€é•¿å¯èƒ½é•¿åº¦ è¾“å…¥è¾“å‡ºç¤ºä¾‹1ï¼š è¾“å…¥ï¼šwords = [â€œaâ€,â€bâ€,â€baâ€,â€bcaâ€,â€bdaâ€,â€bdcaâ€]è¾“å‡ºï¼š4è§£é‡Šï¼šæœ€é•¿å•è¯é“¾ä¹‹ä¸€ä¸º [â€œaâ€,â€baâ€,â€bdaâ€,â€bdcaâ€] ç¤ºä¾‹2: è¾“å…¥ï¼šwords = [â€œxbcâ€,â€pcxbcfâ€,â€xbâ€,â€cxbcâ€,â€pcxbcâ€]è¾“å‡ºï¼š5è§£é‡Šï¼šæ‰€æœ‰çš„å•è¯éƒ½å¯ä»¥æ”¾å…¥å•è¯é“¾ [â€œxbâ€, â€œxbcâ€, â€œcxbcâ€, â€œpcxbcâ€, â€œpcxbcfâ€]. ç¤ºä¾‹3: è¾“å…¥ï¼šwords = [â€œabcdâ€,â€dbqcaâ€]è¾“å‡ºï¼š1è§£é‡Šï¼šå­—é“¾[â€œabcdâ€]æ˜¯æœ€é•¿çš„å­—é“¾ä¹‹ä¸€ã€‚[â€œabcdâ€ï¼Œâ€dbqcaâ€]ä¸æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæœ‰æ•ˆçš„å•è¯é“¾ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå­—æ¯çš„é¡ºåºè¢«æ”¹å˜äº†ã€‚ æç¤ºï¼š 1 <= words.length <= 1000 1 <= words[i].length <= 16 words[i] ä»…ç”±å°å†™è‹±æ–‡å­—æ¯ç»„æˆ æ€è·¯#include <bits/stdc++.h> using namespace std; class Solution { public: int longestStrChain(vector<string> &words) { // é¦–å…ˆå¯¹wordsè¿›è¡Œæ’ä¸ªåºï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§é•¿åº¦æ’åº sort(words.begin(), words.end(), [](const auto &a, const auto &b) { return a.length() < b.length(); }); int ans = 0; unordered_map<string, int> mp; for (auto &s : words) { int res = 0; for (int i = 0; i < s.length(); ++i) { auto it = mp.find(s.substr(0, i) + s.substr(i + 1)); if (it != mp.end()) { res = max(res, it->second); } } ans = max(ans, mp[s] = res + 1); } return ans; } };

posts.title: leetcode 1031
posts.text: é¢˜ç›®ï¼š ç»™ä½ ä¸€ä¸ªæ•´æ•°æ•°ç»„ nums å’Œä¸¤ä¸ªæ•´æ•° firstLen å’Œ secondLenï¼Œè¯·ä½ æ‰¾å‡ºå¹¶è¿”å›ä¸¤ä¸ªéé‡å  å­æ•°ç»„ ä¸­å…ƒç´ çš„æœ€å¤§å’Œï¼Œé•¿åº¦åˆ†åˆ«ä¸º firstLen å’Œ secondLen.é•¿åº¦ä¸º firstLen çš„å­æ•°ç»„å¯ä»¥å‡ºç°åœ¨é•¿ä¸º secondLen çš„å­æ•°ç»„ä¹‹å‰æˆ–ä¹‹åï¼Œä½†äºŒè€…å¿…é¡»æ˜¯ä¸é‡å çš„ã€‚å­æ•°ç»„æ˜¯æ•°ç»„çš„ä¸€ä¸ª è¿ç»­ éƒ¨åˆ†ã€‚ è¾“å…¥è¾“å‡ºç¤ºä¾‹1ï¼š è¾“å…¥ï¼šnums=[0,6,5,2,2,5,1,9,4], firstLen=1, secondLen=2è¾“å‡ºï¼š20è§£é‡Šï¼šå­æ•°ç»„çš„ä¸€ç§é€‰æ‹©ä¸­ï¼Œ[9]é•¿åº¦ä¸º1ï¼Œ[6,5]é•¿åº¦ä¸º2ã€‚ ç¤ºä¾‹2: è¾“å…¥ï¼šnums=[3,8,1,3,2,1,8,9,0], firstLen=3, secondLen=2è¾“å‡ºï¼š29è§£é‡Šï¼šå­æ•°ç»„çš„ä¸€ç§é€‰æ‹©ä¸­ï¼Œ[3,8,1]é•¿åº¦ä¸º3ï¼Œ[8,9]é•¿åº¦ä¸º 2ã€‚ ç¤ºä¾‹3: è¾“å…¥ï¼šnums=[2,1,5,6,0,9,5,0,3,8], firstLen = 4, secondLen = 3è¾“å‡ºï¼š31è§£é‡Šï¼šå­æ•°ç»„çš„ä¸€ç§é€‰æ‹©ä¸­[5,6,0,9]é•¿åº¦ä¸º 4ï¼Œ[0,3,8]é•¿åº¦ä¸º 3ã€‚ æç¤ºï¼š 1 <= firstLen, secondLen <= 1000 2 <= firstLen + secondLen <= 1000 firstLen + secondLen <= nums.length <= 1000 0 <= nums[i] <= 1000 æ€è·¯å‰ç½®çŸ¥è¯†ï¼šå‰ç¼€å’Œ ä½†å¯¹äºæ•°ç»„$nums$ï¼Œå®šä¹‰å‰ç¼€å’Œ$S[0]=0,S[i+1]=\sum\limits_{j=0}^i nums[j]$,ç”±æ­¤ä¸éš¾å¾—å‡º$S[i+1]=S[i]+nums[i]$ã€‚ é€šè¿‡å‰ç¼€å’Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥æŠŠå­æ•°ç»„çš„å…ƒç´ å’Œè½¬åŒ–ä¸ºä¸¤ä¸ªå‰ç¼€å’Œçš„å·®ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯$$\sum\limits_{j=left}^{right}nums[j]=\sum\limits_{j=0}^{right}nums[j]-\sum\limits_{j=0}^{left-1}nums[j]=S[right+1]-S[left]$$ è§£å†³æ€è·¯ï¼šè®¾é•¿åº¦ä¸ºfirstLençš„å­æ•°ç»„ä¸ºaï¼Œé•¿åº¦ä¸ºsecondLençš„å­æ•°ç»„ä¸ºbï¼Œå…ˆè§£å†³å·¦aå³bçš„æƒ…å†µï¼Œç„¶ååŒç†å¤„ç†å³aå·¦bçš„æƒ…å†µã€‚ ä»£ç å®ç° #include <bits/stdc++.h> using namespace std; class Solution { public: int maxSumTwoNoOverlap(vector<int> &nums, int firstLen, int secondLen) { int n = nums.size(), ans = 0, s[n + 1]; s[0] = 0; // è®¡ç®—numsçš„å‰ç¼€å’Œ partial_sum(nums.begin(), nums.end(), s + 1); int maxnumA = 0, maxnumB = 0; for (int i = firstLen + secondLen; i <= n; i++) { maxnumA = max(maxnumA, s[i - secondLen] - s[i - secondLen - firstLen]); maxnumB = max(maxnumB, s[i - firstLen] - s[i - firstLen - secondLen]); ans = max(ans, max(maxnumA + s[i] - s[i - secondLen], maxnumB + s[i] - s[i - firstLen])); } return ans; } };

posts.title: leetcode 2418
posts.text: é¢˜ç›®ï¼š ç»™ä½ ä¸€ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ•°ç»„ names ï¼Œå’Œä¸€ä¸ªç”± äº’ä¸ç›¸åŒ çš„æ­£æ•´æ•°ç»„æˆçš„æ•°ç»„ heights ã€‚ä¸¤ä¸ªæ•°ç»„çš„é•¿åº¦å‡ä¸º n ã€‚å¯¹äºæ¯ä¸ªä¸‹æ ‡ iï¼Œnames[i] å’Œ heights[i] è¡¨ç¤ºç¬¬ i ä¸ªäººçš„åå­—å’Œèº«é«˜ã€‚è¯·æŒ‰èº«é«˜ é™åº é¡ºåºè¿”å›å¯¹åº”çš„åå­—æ•°ç»„ names ã€‚ è¾“å…¥è¾“å‡ºç¤ºä¾‹1ï¼š è¾“å…¥ï¼šnames = [â€œMaryâ€,â€Johnâ€,â€Emmaâ€], heights = [180,165,170]è¾“å‡ºï¼š[â€œMaryâ€,â€Emmaâ€,â€Johnâ€]è§£é‡Šï¼šMary æœ€é«˜ï¼Œæ¥ç€æ˜¯ Emma å’Œ John ã€‚ ç¤ºä¾‹2: è¾“å…¥ï¼šnames = [â€œAliceâ€,â€Bobâ€,â€Bobâ€], heights = [155,185,150]è¾“å‡ºï¼š[â€œBobâ€,â€Aliceâ€,â€Bobâ€]è§£é‡Šï¼šç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ª Bob æœ€é«˜ï¼Œç„¶åæ˜¯ Alice å’Œç¬¬äºŒä¸ª Bob ã€‚ æç¤ºï¼š n == names.length == heights.length 1 <= n <= 103 1 <= names[i].length <= 20 1 <= heights[i] <= 105 names[i] ç”±å¤§å°å†™è‹±æ–‡å­—æ¯ç»„æˆ heights ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰å€¼äº’ä¸ç›¸åŒ è§£å†³æ–¹æ³•#include <bits/stdc++.h> using namespace std; class Solution { struct compare { bool operator()(const int &a, const int &b) const { return a > b; } }; public: vector<string> sortPeople(vector<string> &names, vector<int> &heights) { map<int, string, compare> mp; for (int i = 0; i < names.size(); i++) { mp.insert(make_pair(heights[i], names[i])); } vector<string> ans; for (auto &num : mp) { ans.push_back(num.second); } return ans; } };

void dfs(vector<vector<int>>& relation, int start, int step, int k, int n) { if(step==k){ if(start==n-1){ ans++; } return ; } for(int i = 0; i < relation.size(); i++){ if(relation[i][0] == start) dfs(relation, relation[i][1], step+1, k, n); } } int numWays(int n, vector<vector<int>>& relation, int k) { for(int i=0;i<relation.size();i++){ if(relation[i][0]==0) dfs(relation, relation[i][1], 1, k, n); } return ans; } }; æ€è·¯äºŒåœ¨å›¾ä¸­æœ‰ä¸€ç§æœ‰è¶£çš„æ€§è´¨ï¼Œå½“æˆ‘ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨01çš„é‚»æ¥çŸ©é˜µè¡¨ç¤ºå›¾ä¸­è¾¹é›†çš„è¿é€šæ€§æ—¶ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨é¢†æ¥çŸ©é˜µä¹˜ä»¥é‚»æ¥çŸ©é˜µå¾—åˆ°çš„æ–°çŸ©é˜µä¸­çš„[i][j]è¡¨ç¤ºçš„å°±æ˜¯ä»i->jçš„è·¯çº¿æ•°é‡ class Solution { public: int N; vector<vector<int>>A, A0; void func() { vector<vector<int>>vt(N, vector<int>(N,0)); for(int i=0;i<N;++i){ for(int j=0;j<N;++j){ for(int k=0;k<N;k++){ vt[i][j]+=A[i][k]*A0[k][j]; } } } A = vt; } int numWays(int n, vector<vector<int>>& relation, int k) { N = n; A0.resize(n,vector<int>(n,0)); for(auto& vt : relation ){ A0[vt[0]][vt[1]] = 1; } A= A0; for(int i=1;i<k;++i){ func(); } return A[0][n-1]; } };

posts.text: æ¦‚å¿µå¹¶æŸ¥é›†æ˜¯ä¸€ç§æ ‘å‹çš„æ•°æ®ç»“æ„ï¼Œç”¨äºå¤„ç†ä¸€äº›ä¸ç›¸äº¤é›†åˆçš„åˆå¹¶åŠæŸ¥è¯¢é—®é¢˜ï¼ˆå³æ‰€è°“çš„å¹¶ã€æŸ¥ï¼‰ã€‚æ¯”å¦‚è¯´ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ç”¨å¹¶æŸ¥é›†æ¥åˆ¤æ–­ä¸€ä¸ªæ£®æ—ä¸­æœ‰å‡ æ£µæ ‘ã€æŸä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹æ˜¯å¦å±äºæŸæ£µæ ‘ç­‰ã€‚å¹¶æŸ¥é›†ï¼ˆUnion-Findï¼‰å°±æ˜¯ç”¨æ¥å¯¹é›†åˆè¿›è¡Œ åˆå¹¶ï¼ˆUnionï¼‰ ä¸ æŸ¥è¯¢ï¼ˆFindï¼‰ æ“ä½œçš„ä¸€ç§æ•°æ®ç»“æ„ã€‚ åˆå¹¶ å°±æ˜¯å°†ä¸¤ä¸ªä¸ç›¸äº¤çš„é›†åˆåˆå¹¶æˆä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆã€‚æŸ¥è¯¢ å°±æ˜¯æŸ¥è¯¢ä¸¤ä¸ªå…ƒç´ æ˜¯å¦å±äºåŒä¸€é›†åˆã€‚ ç®€æ˜“ç‰ˆå¹¶æŸ¥é›†æ¨¡æ¿ int n=1001;//å®šä¹‰èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°é‡ int father[1001] //åˆå§‹åŒ–å¹¶æŸ¥é›† int init(){ for(int i=0;i<n;i++){ father[i]=i; } } //å¹¶æŸ¥é›†æŸ¥æ‰¾æ ¹ int find(int x){ return u==father[u]?u:father[u]=find(father[u]);//å‹ç¼©è·¯å¾„ } //å°†v->uè¿™æ¡è¾¹æ·»åŠ åˆ°å¹¶æŸ¥é›†ä¸­ int merge(int u,int v){ u=find(u); v=find(v); if(u==v) return; father[v]=u; } //åœ¨å‡å°‘findå‡½æ•°è¿­ä»£æ¬¡æ•°çš„æƒ…å†µï¼Œä¼˜åŒ–åŠ è¾¹çš„æ“ä½œå°±ä¼šå˜æˆå°†å°é›†åˆè¿æ¥åˆ°å¤§é›†åˆä¸Š int merge_2(int u,int v){ u=find(u); v=find(v); if(u==v) return ; if(size[u]<size[v]) father[u]=v; else father[v]=u; } //åˆ¤æ–­uå’Œvæ˜¯å¦æ˜¯åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæ ¹ä¸‹ int same(int u,int v){ u=find(u); v=find(v); return u==v; } å¸¦æƒå¹¶æŸ¥é›†åœ¨ä¸€èˆ¬çš„å¹¶æŸ¥é›†çš„åŸºç¡€ä¸Šï¼Œåœ¨æ¯æ¡è¾¹ä¸­è®°å½•é¢å¤–çš„ä¿¡æ¯ int n=1001;//å®šä¹‰èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°é‡ int father[1001]; int value[1001]; //åˆå§‹åŒ–å¹¶æŸ¥é›† int init(){ for(int i=0;i<n;i++){ father[i]=i; } } //å¹¶æŸ¥é›†æŸ¥æ‰¾æ ¹ int find(int x){ if(x!=father[x]){ int t=father[x]; father[x]=find(father[x]); value[x]+=value[t]; } return father[x]; } ä¾‹é¢˜é¢˜ç›®æè¿°ï¼š Now and then you play the following game with your friend. Your friend writes down a sequence consisting of zeroes and ones. You choose a continuous subsequence (for example the subsequence from the third to the fifth digit inclusively) and ask him, whether this subsequence contains even or odd number of ones. Your friend answers your question and you can ask him about another subsequence and so on. Your task is to guess the entire sequence of numbers.You suspect some of your friendâ€™s answers may not be correct and you want to convict him of falsehood. Thus you have decided to write a program to help you in this matter. The program will receive a series of your questions together with the answers you have received from your friend. The aim of this program is to find the first answer which is provably wrong, i.e. that there exists a sequence satisfying answers to all the previous questions, but no such sequence satisfies this answer. è¾“å…¥ï¼š The first line of input contains one number, which is the length of the sequence of zeroes and ones. This length is less or equal to 1000000000. In the second line, there is one positive integer which is the number of questions asked and answers to them. The number of questions and answers is less or equal to 5000. The remaining lines specify questions and answers. Each line contains one question and the answer to this question: two integers (the position of the first and last digit in the chosen subsequence) and one word which is either even' or oddâ€™ (the answer, i.e. the parity of the number of ones in the chosen subsequence, where even' means an even number of ones and oddâ€™ means an odd number). è¾“å‡ºï¼š There is only one line in output containing one integer X. Number X says that there exists a sequence of zeroes and ones satisfying first X parity conditions, but there exists none satisfying X+1 conditions. If there exists a sequence of zeroes and ones satisfying all the given conditions, then number X should be the number of all the questions asked. æ ·ä¾‹ï¼š1051 2 even3 4 odd5 6 even1 6 even7 10 odd Sample Output 3 #include<bits/stdc++.h> using namespace std; const int N=5e4+10; int p[N],d[N]; int n,k; int find(int x) { if(x!=p[x]){ int t=p[x]; p[x]=find(p[x]); d[x]=d[x]+d[t]; } return p[x]; } signed main() { cin>>n>>k; int ans=0; for(int i=1;i<=n;i++) p[i]=i; while(k--) { int v,a,b; cin>>v>>a>>b; if(a>n||b>n) { ans++; continue; } int pa=find(a),pb=find(b); if(v==1){ if(pa==pb){//åœ¨åŒä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆå†… if((d[a]-d[b])%3){//å¦‚æœä¸æ˜¯åŒç±»å…³ç³» ans++; } } else {//ä¸åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆå†…ï¼Œè¦åˆå¹¶ p[pa]=pb; d[pa]=d[b]-d[a];//æ›´æ–°ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç”»å›¾ç†è§£ //å› ä¸ºè¦æ»¡è¶³d[b]=d[pa]+d[a] } } else{ if(a==b) {ans++; continue;} else { if(pa==pb){ if((d[a] - d[b] - 1) % 3) ans++; } else { p[pa]=pb;//è¦æ»¡è¶³d[b]=d[pa]+d[a]-1; d[pa]=d[b]-d[a]+1; } } } } cout<<ans<<endl; return 0; }

posts.text: æ€æƒ³ ä»ä¸Šå›¾ä¸­å¯ä»¥çŸ¥é“ï¼Œswinæœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªä¸»è¦çš„ç‰¹ç‚¹ 1:å±‚çº§ç»“æ„ï¼Œç±»ä¼¼äºfpnï¼ŒæŠ½å–ä¸åŒå±‚æ¬¡çš„è§†è§‰ç‰¹å¾ï¼Œä½¿å…¶æ›´é€‚åˆåˆ†å‰²æ£€æµ‹ä»»åŠ¡ï¼Œç›¸æ¯”èµ·VITè€Œè¨€ï¼Œswinæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªåˆ†è¾¨ç‡é€æ¸é™ä½çš„è¿‡ç¨‹ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯å›¾åƒä¸­çš„4,8,16å€æ•°çš„ä¸‹é‡‡æ ·ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯VITåˆ™æ˜¯ä¸€æ”¯ä¿æŒ16å€çš„ä¸‹é‡‡æ ·ã€‚ 2:transformerèŒƒå›´ä¸åŒï¼Œä¸Šå›¾ä¸¤è¾¹çº¢æ¡†ä»£è¡¨åœ¨çº¢æ¡†å†…è¿›è¡Œtransformer,å³è¾¹VITçš„çº¢æ¡†æ˜¯æ•´å¼ å›¾ï¼Œè€Œå·¦è¾¹Swin Transformerçš„çº¢æ¡†æ˜¯åœ¨å°çª—å£ä¸Šè¿›è¡Œçš„ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯swinè¿™ä¸ªè¯çš„æ„æ€ï¼Œåœ¨å°çª—å£è¿›è¡Œtransformer,è€Œéæ•´å¼ å›¾ã€‚ æ¶æ„ æµç¨‹ 1.é¦–å…ˆå°†å›¾åƒè¾“å…¥åˆ°patch Partitionæ¨¡å—ä¸­è¿›è¡Œåˆ†å—ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯å°†ç›¸é‚»çš„$4\times4$çš„åƒç´ ä½œä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªpatchï¼Œç„¶åå†channelæ–¹å‘å±•å¼€ï¼Œå‡è®¾è¾“å…¥çš„æ˜¯RGBä¸‰é€šé“ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæ¯ä¸ªpatchå°±æœ‰$4\times4=16$ä¸ªåƒç´ ï¼Œç„¶åæ¯ä¸ªåƒç´ å€¼æœ‰R,G,Bä¸‰ä¸ªå€¼æ‰€ä»¥å±•å¼€åæœ‰48ä¸ªå€¼ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥é€šè¿‡Patch Partitionåå›¾åƒshapeç”±[H,W,3]å˜æˆäº†[H/4,W/4,48]ã€‚ç„¶ååœ¨é€šè¿‡Linear Embedingå±‚å¯¹æ¯ä¸ªåƒç´ çš„channelæ•°æ®åšçº¿æ€§å˜æ¢ï¼Œç”±48å˜æˆCï¼Œå³å›¾åƒshapeå†ç”±[H/4,W/4,48]å˜æˆäº†[H/4,W/4,C] 2.ç„¶åé€šè¿‡å››ä¸ªstageæ„å»ºä¸åŒå¤§å°çš„ç‰¹å¾å›¾ï¼Œé™¤äº†stage1ä¸­é€šè¿‡ä¸€ä¸ªLinear Embedingå±‚å¤–ï¼Œå‰©ä¸‹ä¸‰ä¸ªstageéƒ½æ˜¯å…ˆé€šè¿‡ä¸€ä¸ªPatch Mergingå±‚è¿›è¡Œä¸‹é‡‡æ ·ã€‚ç„¶åéƒ½æ˜¯é‡å¤å †å Swin Transformer Blockæ³¨æ„è¿™é‡Œçš„Blockå…¶å®æœ‰ä¸¤ç§ç»“æ„ï¼Œå¦‚å›¾(b)ä¸­æ‰€ç¤ºï¼Œè¿™ä¸¤ç§ç»“æ„çš„ä¸åŒä¹‹å¤„ä»…åœ¨äºä¸€ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨äº†W-MSAç»“æ„ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨äº†SW-MSAç»“æ„ã€‚è€Œä¸”è¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªç»“æ„æ˜¯æˆå¯¹ä½¿ç”¨çš„ï¼Œå…ˆä½¿ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªW-MSAç»“æ„å†ä½¿ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªSW-MSAç»“æ„ã€‚æ‰€ä»¥ä½ ä¼šå‘ç°å †å Swin Transformer Blockçš„æ¬¡æ•°éƒ½æ˜¯å¶æ•° Patch Embeddingåœ¨è¾“å…¥è¿›Blockå‰ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦å°†å›¾ç‰‡åˆ‡æˆä¸€ä¸ªä¸ªpatchï¼Œç„¶ååµŒå…¥å‘é‡ã€‚å…·ä½“åšæ³•æ˜¯å¯¹åŸå§‹å›¾ç‰‡è£æˆä¸€ä¸ªä¸ª patch_size * patch_sizeçš„çª—å£å¤§å°ï¼Œç„¶åè¿›è¡ŒåµŒå…¥ã€‚è¿™é‡Œå¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡äºŒç»´å·ç§¯å±‚ï¼Œå°†strideï¼Œkernelsizeè®¾ç½®ä¸ºpatch_sizeå¤§å°ã€‚è®¾å®šè¾“å‡ºé€šé“æ¥ç¡®å®šåµŒå…¥å‘é‡çš„å¤§å°ã€‚æœ€åå°†H,Wç»´åº¦å±•å¼€ï¼Œå¹¶ç§»åŠ¨åˆ°ç¬¬ä¸€ç»´åº¦ class PatchEmbed(nn.Module): r""" Image to Patch Embedding Args: img_size (int): Image size. Default: 224. patch_size (int): Patch token size. Default: 4. in_chans (int): Number of input image channels. Default: 3. embed_dim (int): Number of linear projection output channels. Default: 96. norm_layer (nn.Module, optional): Normalization layer. Default: None """ def __init__(self, img_size=224, patch_size=4, in_chans=3, embed_dim=96, norm_layer=None): super().__init__() img_size = to_2tuple(img_size) patch_size = to_2tuple(patch_size) patches_resolution = [img_size[0] // patch_size[0], img_size[1] // patch_size[1]] self.img_size = img_size self.patch_size = patch_size self.patches_resolution = patches_resolution self.num_patches = patches_resolution[0] * patches_resolution[1] self.in_chans = in_chans self.embed_dim = embed_dim self.proj = nn.Conv2d(in_chans, embed_dim, kernel_size=patch_size, stride=patch_size) if norm_layer is not None: self.norm = norm_layer(embed_dim) else: self.norm = None def forward(self, x): B, C, H, W = x.shape # FIXME look at relaxing size constraints assert H == self.img_size[0] and W == self.img_size[1], \ f"Input image size ({H}*{W}) doesn't match model ({self.img_size[0]}*{self.img_size[1]})." x = self.proj(x).flatten(2).transpose(1, 2) # B Ph*Pw C if self.norm is not None: x = self.norm(x) return x def flops(self): Ho, Wo = self.patches_resolution flops = Ho * Wo * self.embed_dim * self.in_chans * (self.patch_size[0] * self.patch_size[1]) if self.norm is not None: flops += Ho * Wo * self.embed_dim return flops Patch Mergingè¯¦è§£ å¦‚ä¸Šå›¾æ‰€ç¤ºï¼Œå‡è®¾è¾“å…¥Patch Mergingçš„æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ª4x4å¤§å°çš„å•é€šé“ç‰¹å¾å›¾ï¼ˆfeature mapï¼‰ï¼ŒPatch Mergingä¼šå°†æ¯ä¸ª2x2çš„ç›¸é‚»åƒç´ åˆ’åˆ†ä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªpatchï¼Œç„¶åå°†æ¯ä¸ªpatchä¸­ç›¸åŒä½ç½®ï¼ˆåŒä¸€é¢œè‰²ï¼‰åƒç´ ç»™æ‹¼åœ¨ä¸€èµ·å°±å¾—åˆ°äº†4ä¸ªfeature mapã€‚æ¥ç€å°†è¿™å››ä¸ªfeature mapåœ¨æ·±åº¦æ–¹å‘è¿›è¡Œconcatæ‹¼æ¥ï¼Œç„¶ååœ¨é€šè¿‡ä¸€ä¸ªLayerNormå±‚ã€‚æœ€åé€šè¿‡ä¸€ä¸ªå…¨è¿æ¥å±‚åœ¨feature mapçš„æ·±åº¦æ–¹å‘åšçº¿æ€§å˜åŒ–ï¼Œå°†feature mapçš„æ·±åº¦ç”±Cå˜æˆC/2ã€‚é€šè¿‡è¿™ä¸ªç®€å•çš„ä¾‹å­å¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºï¼Œé€šè¿‡Patch Mergingå±‚åï¼Œfeature mapçš„é«˜å’Œå®½ä¼šå‡åŠï¼Œæ·±åº¦ä¼šç¿»å€ã€‚ class PatchMerging(nn.Module): r""" Patch Merging Layer. Args: input_resolution (tuple[int]): Resolution of input feature. dim (int): Number of input channels. norm_layer (nn.Module, optional): Normalization layer. Default: nn.LayerNorm è¯¥å—åŒ…å«äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå‡å°‘é€šé“æ•°çš„æ“ä½œå’Œä¸€ä¸ªå½’ä¸€åŒ–æ“ä½œï¼Œè¾“å…¥åˆ†è¾¨ç‡ä¸º input_resolutionï¼Œç‰¹å¾ç»´åº¦ä¸º dimã€‚ åœ¨forwardæ–¹æ³•ä¸­ï¼Œè¾“å…¥çš„ç‰¹å¾å¼ é‡ x ä¼šè¢«åˆ†æˆå››ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†éƒ½æ˜¯åŸå§‹å¼ é‡çš„ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”è¿™å››ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†ä¼šè¢«æ‹¼æ¥åœ¨ä¸€èµ·ã€‚ ç„¶åï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªæ‹¼æ¥åçš„å¼ é‡ä¼šè¢«å½’ä¸€åŒ–å’Œå‡å°‘é€šé“æ•°ï¼Œæœ€åè¿”å›ç»“æœå¼ é‡ã€‚extra_repræ–¹æ³•ç”¨äºè¿”å›è¯¥æ¨¡å—çš„ä¸€äº›é¢å¤–ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œ flops æ–¹æ³•ç”¨äºè®¡ç®—è¯¥æ¨¡å—çš„è®¡ç®—é‡ã€‚ """ def __init__(self, input_resolution, dim, norm_layer=nn.LayerNorm): super().__init__() self.input_resolution = input_resolution self.dim = dim self.reduction = nn.Linear(4 * dim, 2 * dim, bias=False) self.norm = norm_layer(4 * dim) def forward(self, x): """ x: B, H*W, C è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°xæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå½¢çŠ¶ä¸º[B, HW, C]çš„å¼ é‡ï¼Œå…¶ä¸­Bè¡¨ç¤ºbatch sizeï¼ŒHå’ŒWè¡¨ç¤ºè¾“å…¥å›¾åƒçš„é«˜å’Œå®½ï¼ŒCè¡¨ç¤ºè¾“å…¥é€šé“æ•°ã€‚ è¯¥å‡½æ•°é¦–å…ˆå°†è¾“å…¥xçš„å½¢çŠ¶æ”¹å˜ä¸º[B, H, W, C]ï¼Œç„¶åå°†è¾“å…¥çš„æ¯ä¸ªåƒç´ ç‚¹åˆ†æˆå››ä¸ªå°å—ï¼ˆ2x2ï¼‰ï¼Œåˆ†åˆ«å¯¹æ¯ä¸ªå°å—è¿›è¡Œæ“ä½œï¼Œ å¹¶å°†ç»“æœåœ¨é€šé“ç»´åº¦ä¸Šæ‹¼æ¥èµ·æ¥ï¼Œå¾—åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªå½¢çŠ¶ä¸º[B, H/2W/2, 4*C]çš„å¼ é‡ã€‚æ¥ç€ï¼Œå¯¹è¿™ä¸ªå¼ é‡è¿›è¡Œå½’ä¸€åŒ–å’Œé™ç»´æ“ä½œï¼Œ æœ€åè¿”å›ç»“æœã€‚åœ¨å‡½æ•°æ‰§è¡Œè¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œè¿˜è¿›è¡Œäº†ä¸€äº›æ£€æŸ¥ï¼Œ ä¾‹å¦‚æ£€æŸ¥è¾“å…¥ç‰¹å¾çš„å°ºå¯¸æ˜¯å¦æ­£ç¡®ï¼Œä»¥åŠè¾“å…¥å›¾åƒçš„é«˜å’Œå®½æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºå¶æ•°ã€‚ """ H, W = self.input_resolution B, L, C = x.shape assert L == H * W, "input feature has wrong size" assert H % 2 == 0 and W % 2 == 0, f"x size ({H}*{W}) are not even." x = x.view(B, H, W, C) x0 = x[:, 0::2, 0::2, :] # Default: nn.LayerNorm fused_window_process (bool, optional): If True, use one kernel to fused window shift & window partition for acceleration, similar for the reversed part. Default: False """ def __init__(self, dim, input_resolution, num_heads, window_size=7, shift_size=0, mlp_ratio=4., qkv_bias=True, qk_scale=None, drop=0., attn_drop=0., drop_path=0., act_layer=nn.GELU, norm_layer=nn.LayerNorm, fused_window_process=False): super().__init__() self.dim = dim self.input_resolution = input_resolution self.num_heads = num_heads self.window_size = window_size self.shift_size = shift_size self.mlp_ratio = mlp_ratio if min(self.input_resolution) <= self.window_size: # if window size is larger than input resolution, we don't partition windows self.shift_size = 0 self.window_size = min(self.input_resolution) assert 0 <= self.shift_size < self.window_size, "shift_size must in 0-window_size" self.norm1 = norm_layer(dim) self.attn = WindowAttention( dim, window_size=to_2tuple(self.window_size), num_heads=num_heads, qkv_bias=qkv_bias, qk_scale=qk_scale, attn_drop=attn_drop, proj_drop=drop) self.drop_path = DropPath(drop_path) if drop_path > 0. else nn.Identity() self.norm2 = norm_layer(dim) mlp_hidden_dim = int(dim * mlp_ratio) self.mlp = Mlp(in_features=dim, hidden_features=mlp_hidden_dim, act_layer=act_layer, drop=drop) if self.shift_size > 0: # calculate attention mask for SW-MSA H, W = self.input_resolution img_mask = torch.zeros((1, H, W, 1)) # 1 H W 1 h_slices = (slice(0, -self.window_size), slice(-self.window_size, -self.shift_size), slice(-self.shift_size, None)) w_slices = (slice(0, -self.window_size), slice(-self.window_size, -self.shift_size), slice(-self.shift_size, None)) cnt = 0 for h in h_slices: for w in w_slices: img_mask[:, h, w, :] = cnt cnt += 1 mask_windows = window_partition(img_mask, self.window_size) # nW, window_size, window_size, 1 mask_windows = mask_windows.view(-1, self.window_size * self.window_size) attn_mask = mask_windows.unsqueeze(1) - mask_windows.unsqueeze(2) attn_mask = attn_mask.masked_fill(attn_mask != 0, float(-100.0)).masked_fill(attn_mask == 0, float(0.0)) else: attn_mask = None self.register_buffer("attn_mask", attn_mask) self.fused_window_process = fused_window_process def forward(self, x): H, W = self.input_resolution B, L, C = x.shape assert L == H * W, "input feature has wrong size" shortcut = x x = self.norm1(x) x = x.view(B, H, W, C) # cyclic shift if self.shift_size > 0: if not self.fused_window_process: shifted_x = torch.roll(x, shifts=(-self.shift_size, -self.shift_size), dims=(1, 2)) # partition windows x_windows = window_partition(shifted_x, self.window_size) # nW*B, window_size, window_size, C else: x_windows = WindowProcess.apply(x, B, H, W, C, -self.shift_size, self.window_size) else: shifted_x = x # partition windows x_windows = window_partition(shifted_x, self.window_size) # nW*B, window_size, window_size, C x_windows = x_windows.view(-1, self.window_size * self.window_size, C) # nW*B, window_size*window_size, C # W-MSA/SW-MSA attn_windows = self.attn(x_windows, mask=self.attn_mask) # nW*B, window_size*window_size, C # merge windows attn_windows = attn_windows.view(-1, self.window_size, self.window_size, C) # reverse cyclic shift if self.shift_size > 0: if not self.fused_window_process: shifted_x = window_reverse(attn_windows, self.window_size, H, W) # B H' W' C x = torch.roll(shifted_x, shifts=(self.shift_size, self.shift_size), dims=(1, 2)) else: x = WindowProcessReverse.apply(attn_windows, B, H, W, C, self.shift_size, self.window_size) else: shifted_x = window_reverse(attn_windows, self.window_size, H, W) # B H' W' C x = shifted_x x = x.view(B, H * W, C) x = shortcut + self.drop_path(x) # FFN x = x + self.drop_path(self.mlp(self.norm2(x))) return x æœ€åå°±æ˜¯æŒ‰æ¶æ„å›¾æ‰€è®¾è®¡çš„å°†å››ä¸ªblockç»™å †å èµ·æ¥å¾—åˆ°å®Œæ•´çš„swin-transformerã€‚
